person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Lying fifth after the first run , Shimer and breakman Randy Jones delivered a near-perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds .

Let's think step by step.

1. Shimer
2. Randy Jones

These are the "Person" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

1. Shimer
2. Randy Jones

These are the entities that clearly refer to persons in the paragraph. All other entities, such as "fifth after the first run," "1976 Olympic course," and "one minute 45.91 seconds," do not refer to persons.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Lying fifth after the first run , Shimer and breakman Randy Jones delivered a near-perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds .

Let's think step by step.

1. Olympic course
2. Shimer and breakman (This could be considered as one entity if we consider them as a team)
3. 1976 Olympic (This could be considered as one entity representing the specific Olympic Games)

So, the organization entities in the paragraph are:

1. Olympic course (representing the organizing body of the Olympic event)
2. 1976 Olympic (representing the specific Olympic Games)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.

Organization entities in the paragraph:

1. Olympic course (representing the organizing body of the Olympic event)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Organization |
| --- |
| Olympic course (representing the organizing body of the Olympic event) |
